arch:property.oc:show_val: L8 is a large area of mudbrick collapse mixed with ashy fill south of the mudbrick wall in L7. We opened this locus because the differences between the loose ashy fill and the mudbrick debris areas became more apparent. We changed to L13 and L14 when the area south the wall in L7 was split between soft ashy fill, L13, and hard mudbrick collapse, L14.
loose, ashy fill with large amounts of mudbrick debris, some areas there is solid mudbrick debris
pebbles, pottery, mudbrick debris, plaster, conglomerate rock, backed and burned clay

this fill is characterized by a great amount of mudbrick debris. In the southeast corner of the locus the mudbrick is very hard and has a lot of small pebbles and some flat lying pottery, the rest is areas of ashy fill and loosely sorted mudbrick debris

arch:note.arch:string: Contexts excavated in trenches were recorded using the "locus system." A locus is any discrete three-dimensional entity excavated in a trench. The key to the locus system is the recognition that a locus is any one thing. Differences in soil composition or texture are therefore as important as, for example, the difference between a pit and a wall. If two entities were distinct, they were considered separate loci and were therefore assigned separate locus numbers. It should also be noted that every context excavated in a trench was given a locus number and thus the trench itself is made up completely of excavated loci.

oc:metadata.dc:title: Kenan Tepe: Area A / Trench 9 / Locus 8 (Locus)
